content: Name five writers who were part of the Harlem Renaissance and include what type of writing they were most known for.

chosen:
The Harlem Renaissance was a time in history when African American artists, musicians, poets, playwrights, and scholars thrived. The following five authors contributed significantly to this cultural movement: 
1. Langston Hughes - poetry 
2. Zora Neale Hurston - literature and folklore 
3. Claude McKay - poetry and novels 
4. Countee Cullen - poetry 
5. W.E.B. Du Bois - sociology and history
rejected:
The Harlem Renaissance was a time when art, music, and literature flourished in the Harlem neighborhood of New York City. Here are five writers from that period:

1) Langston Hughes - Poetry
2) Zora Neale Hurston - Fiction
3) Claude McKay - Poetry 
4) Countee Cullen - Poetry
5) W.E.B. Du Bois - Essays and Sociological Writing
